Posts.Title: Kayleigh/Puppies/Life... ForTheMoment Maya1

Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: To quote from last week... I'm having a scanic attack, or scanxiety. I finally got scheduled for all my scans at my new cancer treatment center here in Iowa.  The good news is I have them all scheduled for the same day (Brain, PET, Chest) and will even get the results the same day while at the clinic! That is the best part.  I am so happy I won't have to deal with the waiting.  The bad news is, they can't get me in until next Friday.  A week from tomorrow!  That is the only time they could get me in for all the scans, and to see the doc on the same day.  So that means, by the time I actually see my doc and get a new plan, I will have missed 3 1/2 weeks of chemo.  Yikes!!! They seem to think that is ok, but it sure makes me nervous.  Tell me the chemo break is ok and just to enjoy it.  I'm making myself crazy worrying about what might be happening while we wait. Thanks all... Erin Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: The boo........... ForTheMoment Fitztwins

Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: Doc just called. Not bad considering we only got my results on Friday, and he was out of town until yesterday. Much improved from response time a few months ago. Anyway, I start new treatment today. Gemzar and Navelbine, two weeks on, one week off. They don't want me to go to England. Said if I take the time off to do that, things could get out of control pretty quickly. I hate this!! I'm so sick of not getting to "live" the way we want, when we want. Very frustrating. Also scared about how quickly they wanted me in, etc. Maybe things are a little more out of control than I wanted to admit. Feeling a bit uneasy today all. Asking for some positive energy/thoughts/prayers. Thanks... Erin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New treatment plan in place... ForTheMoment jacqniel

Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: That is the question.... Soooo... my office just called. For the last year and a half, I've been working from home part time. Before I got pregnant, and was told I had cancer, I worked full time as an Operations Manager in a great multi-million dollar company. It was a great job and I took one heck of pay cut to stay home with my daughter. My boss gave me the opportunity to do that, because I had cancer, and was pregnant. Now however, they just called and would like me to come back to the office (at least a few days a week) and maybe transition back into full time. I'm so very confused! Before I had my daughter and was diagnosed with cancer, I was quite the career woman. Since coming home, I've become quite the mommy and been ok with working part-time. Especially since being diagnosed at Stage IV. The thing is, sometimes I miss my job, the fat pay-check, and the adult conversations I used to have. (rather than playing peek a boo and asking my daughter if she has to go potty all day.. ) My health right now is very good, but do I want to wait until it starts to fail to come home? I am getting such quality time with my daughter, and working from home allows me to travel to see family when I want, etc. They just completely rail-roaded me this morning. I don't even know is staying home is going to be an option. I told them to let me know by Monday what my salary would be and that I would contact some day cares in the area, etc. Yikes... so this is not exactly cancer related, but I came to my "cancer family" to vent. What does everyone think?? How many of you still work? Would you stay home, or work, if it was up to you??? HELP!!! I used to be good at making decisions. It is either chemo-brain, or my mind is full of all the daily things of dealing with cancer, that it can't find room to think clearly it seems. Thanks in advance for any thoughts... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hmmm.. to work, or not to work ForTheMoment faeriesong

Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: Did anyone else read the transcript from the on-line conference they had regarding metastatic disease?  I read it tonight and found it very uplifting and encouraging.  This was the best paragraph of all..   "I have people with metastatic breast cancer that I've cared for for 25 years. I expect that we're going to see more and more people with long survival with this disease, which is always a prelude towards disease cure. I've seen cures over the years I've been involved in cancer medicine. It's always a chronic disease before it becomes a curable one, and I suspect we're in that transition now" This is the link for those that may not have read it. http://www.breastcancer.org/community/ask_expert/index.jsp   Love and hugs to all... Erin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Metastatic conference news...:) ForTheMoment Fitztwins

Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: Hey all, This is Steve again...... Erin's sis in law asked me to post this:- A message from Gina Battani ginabattani@gmail.com. This year, hundreds of thousands of people will hear the words "you have breast cancer," and there's a good chance that some of them will be people we know and love. I have chosen to fight back against this disease and help make a difference by participating in the American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer® walk ... and I hope you will join me. Making Strides Against Breast Cancer is our opportunity to honor and celebrate breast cancer survivors, educate women about early detection and prevention, and raise money to fund lifesaving research and support programs to help fight breast cancer. But Making Strides is more than just the name of a walk. It describes the amazing progress we can make if we work together to defeat this disease. Below is a link to my team page. I hope you will visit my site and sign up to join my team. If you prefer, you can start your own team, or sign up to walk as an individual. Hope starts with me and it can continue with you. Please join my team and walk with us to experience an incredible day of inspiration and meaning, and to provide hope for all people facing breast cancer. Hope starts with you and me let's walk! The American Cancer Society's state fundraising notices can be reviewed at: main.acsevents.org/statefundraisingnotices Click here to visit my personal page. If the text above does not appear as a clickable link, you can visit the web address: main.acsevents.org/site/TR/Mak... Click here to view the team page for Erin Elise If the text above does not appear as a clickable link, you can visit the web address: main.acsevents.org/site/TR/Mak... Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: Hi all... as most of you know, I got knocked on my arse last week with Gemzar, Navelbine, Avastin and Zometa and was pretty sick for a few days. Now I know why!! I met with my onc today before receiving treatment. He said he totally expected me to end up in the hospital over the weekend. They had given me strict orders to get to the ER if I declined over the weekend, but didn't let on how serious it was. Guess the nurses didn't really know what the onc had on the back of his mind. Turns out.. there has been some research that people with liver disease may have an adverse reaction to chemo. To the tune of shutting the liver down. Apparently it attacks those cancer cells so harshly that the liver sometimes cannot recover, causing the high fever, and eventual liver shut down. Yikes!! He was very worried as my white blood cell count dropped down to very dangerous levels in just one day. Soooo.... my counts are slowly getting back to where they need to be, my fever has finally stabalized at around 100 and I am starting to feel more human. They obviously took me off the gemzar and I am now getting navelbine alone.. (of course with the avastin, lupron and Zometa). Just thought I would share with all. Apparently gemzar is perfectly safe for a lot of people with liver disease, but there is enough evidence that it can be very dangerous if the person has a strong reaction, that he felt the need to pull me off it immediately and check my counts every day for four days. Kind of scary, but sure am glad my onc seems to be on the ball! He is amazing! So, I went from three and a half hours of chemo last week, to 10 minutes this week. Sure hope the navelbine can do the job alone! Thanks for all your well wishes and prayers last week. Really appreciate it!! Love and hugs.. Erin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Update ForTheMoment LuAnnH

Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: Ok... so Xeloda failed me. I refuse to say I failed Xeloda. Anyway.... so it failed. My feet finally look like human feet again, as opposed to a snake losing its skin.. I can get pedacures again.. I love pedacures, and have so misssed them! So.. Xeloda failed me.. I'm on navelbine.. Seems to have lessened my appetite for sweets, heavy foods, etc. and I've lost 10 lbs in the last couple weeks. (nobody worry, I'm still getting plenty of nutrition)... So Xeloda failed me... I feel more sexy than I have in awhile and actually put on make-up before leaving the house today... So... Xeloda technically.... did me a favor. Tis all.. have a great holiday weekend! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Two silver linings.... ;) ForTheMoment jacqniel

Posts.Content: ForTheMoment wrote: Sunday May 11th 2008.   Back in England after 3 and a half years.   Its nice to be home, its nice to eat the food that I used to like so much so far I have had Lamb chops with new potatoes and mint sauce, gravy and yorkshire puddings. Meat and potatoe pie with a crust. Bacon barms/butties with HP brown sauce. Steak with roast & new potatoes, gravy, mushrooms and Onions. Profiterolls with cream, chips, peas, pudding and gravy from the local chippy....Oh and we went to a sportsmans dinner on Friday and I got a kebab on the way home...lovely :-)   We played a rotten trick on mum & dad. We arrived on Saturday and Derek & Anne collected us from the airport, Derek was having a belated house warming on Sunday so all the family was at his house. Kayleigh and I came to the house and called on the phone from outside. I spoke to Derek a while and then asked to speak to mum, told her we had booked a flight and were coming early in June. She was so happy and was already crying on the phone. Then we walked in while still on the phone.... needless to say there were a lot of tears. Last time mum & dad saw Kayleigh she was just a few months old and barely rolling around.   We have been here just over 1 week and it feels like longer, but then again it will pass much quicker than I want it too. Kayleigh is having fun, being spoiled by Nan & Grandad and all her aunties & uncle.  Being back here, in my house is also a little strange Lorraine has done a nice job with the decorating but my room is pretty much as I left it. Makes me a little sad too, the last memories I have of being here was when Erin came for Xmas and I remember how excited she was to meet my family and spend some time in England. She was real sick with a cold that 10 days, but we made the most of it and did Yaeger shots every night (just to fight the germs).   Kayleigh is loving having stairs, she is up and down them every opportunity she gets. Though she is struggling with the concept of up and down, when she is down she points and says "downstairs" and when she is up, visa versa. Kayleigh is also enjoying going outside in the over grown garden. It has been real nice this week 70's all week, which is nice. I didnt want her memories of England to be ("where the sky is low and it rains all the time").   Today is a big day, it is the last day of the English football season and Manchester United need to win to ensure they retain thier title. We are going to uncle Derek's to watch it and Kayleighs has a new shirt just for the occassion. (They better win).   Tuesday 13th May 2008   .... And they did, still have to play Chelsea in the champions league final on the 21st to do the big double, sir Alex Ferguson (i am sure you all know who that is, if not google it...) has just been named manager of the year.   The weather is still looking good.... keeping fingers crossed..... Kales has been out to the local parks, with Nan & Grandad and went to Chester zoo yesterday with Derek and Anne (brought back a tiger, no clue where I am going to keep it, its actually a balloon tiger)...but still takes up room... Kayleigh has been to the park today with her gt cousin kian and auntie Caroline and cousin Deb.   I think thats all for now... Here are some piccys...   http://cards.webshots.com/invite/pickup/140563324ShMO/album/563392164uDHNAI   http://cards.webshots.com/invite/pickup/140563325pXMf/album/563402454OSvCtW  Wishing the best for all you wonderful ladies... Take care all Steve & Kayleigh Log in to post a reply
